record.description: Art Institute of Chicago, Grant Park. Trustees of the Art Institute cooperated in building a hall for the congresses held in conjunction with the World's Columbian Exposition in 1893, and after the conclusion of the fair used it to house the growing art collections of the city (from lantern slide original).
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Three images are photos and the fourth (the scanned image) is a glass lantern slide. Original located in City Planning Lantern Slides (copy print made February, 1992). Printed for "The University and the City: A Centennial View of the University of Chicago." March 26-June 9, 1992.
